Michigan: s governor, Gretchen Whitmer, implemented actions to limit the spread of the coronavirus, most of which were lifted by June 1.
Currently: Michiganders are allowed to dine out, attend school, get a haircut, and go bowling, indicating that the state is not under excessive restrictions.
President Donald Trump: s claim that Michigan has been "like a prison" due to COVID-19 restrictions is not accurate, as the state has reopened various businesses and allowed in-person learning in schools.
Whitmer: s stay-at-home order and business restrictions were lifted statewide by June 1, and since then, bars, restaurants, barbershops, spas, salons, casinos, gyms, movie theaters, bowling alleys, and houses of worship have been allowed to reopen with safety precautions in place.
